name: Create a hook
description:
**Note**: Repository service hooks (like email or Campfire) can have at most one configured at a time. Creating hooks for a service that already has one configured will [update the existing hook](#edit-a-hook).

Repositories can have multiple webhooks installed. Each webhook should have a unique `config`. Multiple webhooks can share the same `config` as long as those webhooks do not have any `events` that overlap.

The `config` object can accept the following keys:

Here's how you can create a hook that posts payloads in JSON format:

params.name: config
params.description: Key/value pairs to provide settings for this webhook. [These are defined below](#create-hook-config-params).

params.name: events
params.description: Determines what [events](/v3/activity/events/types/) the hook is triggered for.

params.name: active
params.description: Determines if notifications are sent when the webhook is triggered. Set to `true` to send notifications.

name: Edit a hook
description: The `config` object can accept the following keys:

params.name: config
params.description: Key/value pairs to provide settings for this webhook. [These are defined below](#create-hook-config-params).

params.name: events
params.description: Determines what [events](/v3/activity/events/types/) the hook is triggered for. This replaces the entire array of events.

params.name: add_events
params.description: Determines a list of events to be added to the list of events that the Hook triggers for.

params.name: remove_events
params.description: Determines a list of events to be removed from the list of events that the Hook triggers for.

params.name: active
params.description: Determines if notifications are sent when the webhook is triggered. Set to `true` to send notifications.

name: Test a push hook
description:
This will trigger the hook with the latest push to the current repository if the hook is subscribed to `push` events. If the hook is not subscribed to `push` events, the server will respond with 204 but no test POST will be generated.

**Note**: Previously `/repos/:owner/:repo/hooks/:id/test`

name: Ping a hook
description: This will trigger a [ping event](/webhooks/#ping-event) to be sent to the hook.
